topics.body:
I just realized something; I'm borderline misanthropic but not in the traditional "humans suck" kind but rather I hate a metric fuck ton of ideals.

Things I hate:
"I am enlightened" crowd.
The "if science says I'm wrong then science is wrong" crowd.
"My beliefs can't ever be wrong and they are infallible" crowd.
"Anything that is presented poorly regardless of how factual they are automatically wrong because they were presented poorly even if they are true" fallacy crowd.
"If science says I'm wrong then science must be 'corrected'" crowd.
"Your rights end where my emotions begin"
"The amount I'm an asshole is the amount I'm right about everything" crowd.
"I don't hate science; I just think society would be better if we still lived in caves and used rocks to create fire"
"I don't hate technology; I just think destroying entire nations' economies for the sake of preserving my morals is the right thing to do"
"I don't hate religion/other religions; I just think all religious people/other religions should be put into education camps"
"I don't hate non-religious people; I just think they should be required to go to my religion's place of worship or thrown in jail"
Progressives cause it's been bastardized into "society by force and at the end of a gun must be changed to suit my beliefs"
Conservatives cause it's been bastardized into "society by force and at the end of a gun must be changed to suit my beliefs"
"I know everything" crowd
"I'm specialized in this one topic therefore I know everything and everyone else is inherently wrong about everything and I'm infallible" crowd.
"Society is going downhill regardless of any evidence to the contrary"
"The world is ending!"
"I'm not racist; I just think n*****s should be sent back to africa" people.
"I'm not racist; I just think 'crackers' are inherently racist"
"I'm not homophobic; I just think f*****s should have their sexuality 'corrected'"
"I'm not heterophobic; I just hate straight people"
"I'm not homophobic; I just think 'trannies' should be castrated"
"I'm not 'cisphobic'; I just think cis scum should die"
"I'm not sexist; I just believe women belong in the kitchen"
"I'm not sexist; I just think men are scum"
"I'm not xenophobic; I just think other nationalities are inherently violent criminals"


Call me crazy, but personally in ten-twenty years considering all the cool shit that's coming out that's going to change the world for the better I would not be surprised if the people who think the world is going to hell or such start carbombing or such to "prove to the world that the world is violent" or such crap.  What I mean by this is that even on the little scale synthesized food; I've seen people argue that synthesized food research should be banned because trying to end world hunger is "evil".  I've seen people argue that how we're only a couple years off of a cure for HIV that the research to cure HIV is "evil".  I've seen people argue that how 3d printing(imagine being able to house homeless for a fraction of the current price) may end homelessness is "evil" cause trying to end homelessness is "evil".  I've seen how computers are taking over controlling businesses financially is "evil" cause on the macro scale if/when all companies are controlled financially by computers that'll be the end of boom-bust cycles and therefore fixing bust cycles is "evil".

Well they don't directly say that trying to make the world a better place is "evil" per say, but tend to beat around the bush and give a bullshit reason to justify their morality.  If someone says that children should starve to death to preserve their morals I highly doubt they're being logical.


I don't know; I would rather be "evil" than "good" cause nowadays 95% of the time whenever someone says that something is evil they either mean "doesn't fit my morality therefore it's evil" or such.  I do believe there is such a thing as evil, but rather my personal definition of the source of evil is individuals who directly cause harm to others for the sake of proving one's self to be good.  Evil people don't just fucking pop out of thin air.  "Evil" is a learned personality trait; they don't just fucking pop out of thin air.  I know it's a Godwin, but Hitler didn't just pop out of fucking thin air with a army one day and invade Poland; he was once a child and grew into the adult history talks about; if he had a different family situation and was accepted into college then chances are WWII would have never happened cause he didn't just pop out of thin air like a deus ex machina.


I don't know; I just think too many people think the world works like in comic books where the villain pops out of thin air one day materializing out of thin air and starts destroying the town.

If I had wish from a prankster genie or some mythological creature I would wish for the word "evil" to be removed from all dictionaries, all languages and from all people's minds cause with how many people operate on the idea of "anything different me is evil" society would just utterly overnight collapse.  I totally agree that there is such a thing as evil, but most of the time "evil" is just a synonym for different.

Imagine what would happen to the world if the word "evil" just popped out of existence one second; imagine the face on all the homophobes, racists, sexists and xenophobes faces just *pop* the word "evil" is just instantly gone from their mind.  Think about how much these ideologies rely on "anything <x> is evil" and just pop the word "evil" just gone.
